thread.title: Adele botches George Michael tribute, curses, asks for do-over

author: USA TODAY
title: Adele botches George Michael tribute, curses, asks for do-over
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Adele botches George Michael tribute, curses, asks for do-over "I'm sorry, I can't mess this up for him," she said before starting over on 'Fastlove.' Post to Facebook Adele botches George Michael tribute, curses, asks for do-over "I'm sorry, I can't mess this up for him," she said before starting over on 'Fastlove.' Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Adele botches George Michael tribute, curses, asks for do-over Jayme Deerwester , USA TODAY 10:12 p.m. ET Feb. 12, 2017 Adele started over when her George Michael tribute after she wasn't happy with the beginning. (Photo: Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
When you're Adele and you're not satisfied with your tribute to an inspiration and countryman, you start over. 
The British songstress had begun a soulful cover of George Michael's Fastlove when something seemed to go wrong, causing her to swear (which was covered by the customary seven-second delay) and stopped the performance. 
"I'm sorry, I can't mess this up for him," she said. "Can we start over?" 
And the band did. 
When she finished the number a few minutes later, she shed a tear as the audience got on its feet for a standing ovation. 
All is forgiven, Adele. Read or Share this story: http://usat.ly/2kAQT8c NEVER MISS OUT Life Be a pop culture maven. Get the news, reviews and the juiciest celebrity stories that keep you in the know, Monday-Friday. THANKS FOR SIGNING UP FOR THE Life NEWSLETTER 
We're sorry.
